column4: Hi, I tried to install the ATI Display drivers for Hardy and it clearly is not functioning correctly. How can I revert to alsa?
alsa == sound. ati == graphics
joaopinto then how do I switch to default drivers?
copy back your xorg.conf file from the one you backed up, or simply put vesa instead of fglx (or whatever it is) in your xorg.conf
vesa, that's right
Thanks
have you forwarded the port to you web server machine?
Yep.
I'm pretty sure
id check, thats all that neds setting up. Id set the webserver to static IP
as it may get a different ip on reboot
try powering the router off and on
and verify your wan ip
When I get on the LAN I can accesss it
check your router config dude, if you can conect on lan then its setup fine
maybe it is only accepting connections from the LAN
apache2: Could not reliably determine the server's fully qualified domain name, using 127.0.1.1 for ServerName
you may need to check in /etc/resolv.conf
make sure your own servername is in there and resolving to 127.0.0.1
Okay
as well as your own localhost IP
compiz has the scale plugin
i just did it by accident
there certainly is a way
